sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含有"普通的，普遍的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: common, ordinary, commonplace, general, usual, popular, universal
means: common ： 多用于指物，侧重很常见，不稀奇。
ordinary ： 用于物，指每天发生，十分平淡无奇；用于人，指无特别之处，很一般。
general ： 语气强于common，侧重大多如此，很少有例外情况。
usual ： 指常见常闻和常做的事或举动，强调惯常性。
popular ： 指适应大众爱好、需要，为大家所公认或接受。
universal与general同义，但语气较强，侧重对每个人或事物都适用，根本没有例外。

word_mean: 一般的，全身的，广泛的：影响机体许多部分或所有部分，而非局部的

sentence.Network_en: The operation is carried out under a general anaesthetic.
sentence.Network_cn: 该手术是在全身麻醉情况下实施的。

sentence.Network_en: The Afro-Asian nations had approved the basic general principles of non-alignment.
sentence.Network_cn: 亚非国家已经同意了不结盟的基本通则。

sentence.Network_en: She had a confused idea of life in general.
sentence.Network_cn: 总的来说，她对生活非常困惑。

means.word_mean: 一般的;非专业性的;公众的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin generalis, from genus, gener- 'class, race, kind'. The noun primarily denotes a person having overall authority: the sense 'army commander' is an abbreviation of captain general, from French capitaine général 'commander-in-chief'

entry.def: A general is a high-ranking officer in the armed forces, usually in the army.

example.ex: The General's visit to Sarajevo is part of preparations for the deployment of extra troops.
example.tran: 将军造访萨拉热窝是在为增加兵力部署做准备。

entry.def: If you talk about the general situation somewhere or talk about something in general terms, you are describing the situation as a whole rather than considering its details or exceptions.

example.ex: The figures represent a general decline in employment.
example.tran: 这些数字显示就业人数总体在下降。

entry.def: You use general to describe several items or activities when there are too many of them or when they are not important enough to mention separately.

example.ex: £2,500 for software is soon swallowed up in general costs...
example.tran: 用于软件方面的2,500英镑很快就被一般性费用耗光了。

example.ex: His firm took over the planting and general maintenance of the park last March.
example.tran: 他的公司去年3月接管了公园的绿化和日常维护工作。

entry.def: You use general to describe something that involves or affects most people, or most people in a particular group.

example.ex: The project should raise general awareness about bullying.
example.tran: 这个项目将会提高民众对恃强凌弱行径的认识。

entry.def: If you describe something as general, you mean that it is not restricted to any one thing or area.

example.ex: ...a general ache radiating from the back of the neck.
example.tran: 从后颈部扩散到全身的疼痛

entry.def: A general business offers a variety of services or goods rather than just one particular kind.

example.ex: They ran the general store and the farm dairy.
example.tran: 他们经营着杂货店和农场的乳品店。

entry.tran: （常用于头衔中）首席的，总管的，级别最高的
entry.def: General is used to describe a person's  job, usually as part of their title, to indicate that they have complete responsibility for the administration of an organization or business.

example.ex: He joined Sanders Roe, moving on later to become General Manager.
example.tran: 他加入了桑德斯·罗公司，后来一路晋升至总经理。

entry.tran: （员工）普通的，非专业的，一般的
entry.def: General workers do a variety of jobs which require no special skill or training.

example.ex: The farm employed a tractor driver and two general labourers.
example.tran: 农场雇用了一名拖拉机手和两名杂工。

entry.tran: （对某方面的知识或兴趣）一般的，泛泛的
entry.def: General is used to describe a person who has an average amount of knowledge or interest in a particular subject.

example.ex: This book is intended for the general reader rather than the student.
example.tran: 这本书面向一般读者而非学生。

entry.tran: 总的来说；总体上来看；大体上
entry.def: You use in general to indicate that you are talking about something as a whole, rather than about part of it.

example.ex: I think we need to improve our educational system in general...
example.tran: 我认为有必要从整体上改进我们的教育体系。

example.ex: She had a confused idea of life in general.
example.tran: 总的来说，她对生活非常困惑。

entry.tran: （指某一群体的大多数）总的来说，总体上
entry.def: You say in general to indicate that you are referring to most people or things in a particular group.

example.ex: People in general will support us...
example.tran: 总体而言，人们会支持我们的。

example.ex: She enjoys a sterling reputation in law enforcement circles and among the community in general.
example.tran: 总的说来，她在执法界和老百姓当中口碑甚佳。

entry.def: You say in general to indicate that a statement is true in most cases.

example.ex: In general, it was the better-educated voters who voted Yes in the referendum.
example.tran: 通常是那些受教育程度较高的人在全民公决中投赞成票。

means.word_mean: 1. a general officer of the highest rank
2. the head of a religious order or congregation
3. a fact about the whole (as opposed to particular);

sentences.sentence: "he discussed the general but neglected the particular"

means.word_mean: 1. applying to all or most members of a category or group;
2. not specialized or limited to one class of things;
4. prevailing among and common to the general public;

sentences.sentence: "bearing a general resemblance to the original"
"the shrewdest political and ecumenical comment of our time"- Christopher Morley

auth_sentence.content: General Fiasco are certainly giving it their best shot.
auth_sentence.res_content: General Fiasco are certainly giving it their best shot.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: General Fiasco are certainly giving it their best shot.

auth_sentence.content: Contrast this, for example, with general relativity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Contrast this, for example, with general relativity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Contrast this, for example, with general relativity.

auth_sentence.content: Blacks in general were not blamed for the crime.
auth_sentence.res_content: Blacks in general were not blamed for the crime.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Blacks in general were not blamed for the crime.

Sentence.sentence: Scientists are in general agreement that the warmer conditions we have been experiencing are at least in part the result of a human-induced global warming trend.
The general principle is simple: whenever the body has been in one position for a while, it is good to briefly stretch it in an opposite position.
What is the general guideline the Rand researchers suggest about junk food control
As for craftsmanship itself, the issue is how to preserve it as a valued skill in the general population.

In a late 1990s study of blue-collar employees at a General Motors plant (now closed) in Linden, N. J., the sociologist Ruth Milkman of City University of New York found that many line workers, in their off-hours, did home renovation and other skilled work.
Does this suggest that a woman in a nation's top office translates to better lives for women in general?

means.word_mean: 普遍的, 全面的; 总体的, 整体的

sentences.en: The general opinion is in favour of us.
These difficulties are general among people of his age.
sentences.cn: 这些困难在他那个年龄的人中普遍存在。

means.word_mean: 正常的, 常规的; 通常的

sentences.en: The serum is available to the general public.
sentences.cn: 一般公众均可获得血清。

sentences.en: I have a general idea of how a car works.
sentences.cn: 我对汽车怎样工作有一个大致的了解。

sentences.en: He has been promoted to general manager.

means.word_mean: 【军事】将军：1). (美国陆空军的)上将 ；2). (美国陆军的)将军，准将，少将，中将，(四星)上将，(五星)上将；3). (美国海军陆战队的)上将；4). (英国陆军、海军陆战队的)上将

sentences.en: The general assigned him to do the tough task.
sentences.cn: 将军派他去完成这项艰巨的任务。

jushi.english: They'll soon be having another general strike.
jushi.chinese: 不久他们将再次举行总罢工。

jushi.english: This will demonstrate the general principle.
jushi.chinese: 这将论证那个普遍原理。

jushi.english: There should be a general trend toward a stable population rather than one that will continue to increase.
jushi.chinese: 总的趋势应当是人口稳定,而不是继续增长。
